alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 7:34PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Yuma County in northeastern Colorado and northwestern Cheyenne Counties in northwestern Kansas through 800 PM MDT/900 PM CDT/... At 734 PM MDT/834 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Wray, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Yuma County in northeastern Colorado and northwestern Cheyenne Counties in northwestern Kansas, including the following locations... Beecher Island. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 224 and 237. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT/100 AM CDT/ for northeastern Colorado...and northwestern Kansas.
